subject: History
title: The 300 at Thermopylae
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The 300 at Thermopylae.

hook.text: In 480 BC, 300 Spartans held a narrow pass against an army of over 100,000 Persians.

buildup.text: King Leonidas chose the pass at Thermopylae because its narrow width negated Persian numbers.

discovery.text: For two days, the Greeks held. Persian arrows darkened the sky. Spartans fought in the shade.

twist.text: A traitor showed the Persians a mountain path around the pass. Leonidas was surrounded.

climax.text: The 300 died fighting but bought Greece time. Athens evacuated, and the fleet won at Salamis.

punchline.text: Three hundred soldiers saved Western civilization.

quiz.question: How did the Persians ultimately get past the Spartans at Thermopylae?
options: They overwhelmed them with sheer numbers
A traitor revealed a secret mountain path
They waited for the Spartans to run out of food
